fields.title: Indiana Public Higher Education Degree Completions 2005-2006 Through 2017-2018
fields.data_usage_policy: These data are being provided for educational purposes for use in Applied Data Analytics program. Dataset may only be accessed and used by ADRF users who are members of a course using these data.
fields.data_steward_organization: Coleridge Initiative

degree_conferred_date.description: The date (month/year) on which the student received a degree

gender_code.description: Student's gender. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = GenderCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the GenderCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

residency_status_code.description: Identifies the specific residency or non-residency type of the student. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = ResidencyStatusCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the ResidencyStatusCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

degree_level_code.description: Code corresponding to the degree level of the student (ex. Certificates, Associates, Bachelors, Masters, Doctoral, etc). Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = DegreeLevelCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the DegreeLevelCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

location_code.description: The Indiana county, U.S. state, or country of origin for the student at the time of first admission to an institution. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = LocationCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the LocationCode in this table to the Code field to get the label. Location codes '001' through '092' represent Indiana county codes.  Codes '101' through '151' represent state codes.  Codes '201' through '965' represent country codes and code '940', '942', '999' represents 'unknown'

reporting_year.description: The year for which the completion records are being reported on.  The trailing year is reported in the records (e.g., 2014-2015 is reported as 2015)

ssn_available_flag.description:
Flag to determine if the social security number is available for the student. From the 2011-2012 school forward, only the last 4-digits of the SSN were available from the higher education records.  A match was done with workforce data and other DWD (Indiana Department of Workforce Development) sources to obtain a full SSN for these students.   If a valid SSN was found for the student, a 'Y' will populate this field.  Otherwise, the field will be populated with 'N' and won't be matchable to other records.  Invalid SSNs include numbers considered invalid by the social security administration (defined at https://secure.ssa.gov/poms.nsf/lnx/0110201035).


Y=a valid SSN was available for the student
N=a valid SSN was not available for the student

categories.label: a valid SSN was available for the student
a valid SSN was not available for the student

cip_2010_six_digit_code.description: Six digit CIP 2010 federal ID  for the academic program in which the student obtained their degree. Lookup file in cipcodes.csv.  Match from field CIP2010SixDigitCode in this table to field cipcode in the CSV file

che_campus_unit_id.description: Unique identifier for public higher education campus where student completed their degree. Lookup file in campus_codes.csv - match from field CHECampusUnitID in this table to field CHECampusUnitID in this CSV file

ethnicity_code.description: Student's ethnicity. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = EthnicityCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the EthnicityCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

fields.access_requirements: Dataset may only be accessed and used by members of the Applied Data Analytics course using these data.
fields.description: Degree completion records from all public higher institutions in Indiana. This set includes records level data, including year of degree completions, social security number, degree by CIP and degree level of program of degree completions, demographics, residency status at time of college entry, location of origin, and date on which the student received their degree. Private institutions in Indiana are not included in this dataset.
fields.dataset_citation: Indiana Commission for Higher Education (DWD), 2019, "Indiana Public Higher Education Degree Completions 2005-2006 Through 2017-2018", Applied Data Analytics Course [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a statistical measure of change, over time, of the prices of goods and services in major expenditure groups--such as food, housing, apparel, transportation, and medical care--typically purchased by urban consumers. Essentially, it compares the cost of a sample "market basket" of goods and services in a specific month relative to the cost of the same "market basket" in an earlier reference period. This reference period is designated as the base period.


The CPI publishes indexes for two populations; all urban consumers (CU) and urban wage earners and clerical workers (CW). This dataset is for all urban consumers.


To construct the two indexes, thousands of prices for commodities and services purchased by consumers are collected in a sample of 75 urban places. Rent data is collected in a separate sample of thousands of rental units. Comparison of indexes for individual CMSA's or cities show only the relative change over time in prices between locations. These indexes cannot be used to measure interarea differences in price levels or living costs.
fields.dataset_citation: US Bureau of Labor Statistics, 2018, "Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U)", https://download.bls.gov/pub/time.series/cu/, US Bureau of Labor Statistics [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.description: School Ground locations. The dataset contains locations and attributes of schopol grounda, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. Originally created by Baker, DCPS enhanced and corrected this file to approximate school ground locations. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: The American Community Survey (ACS) is part of the U.S. Census Bureau's Decennial Census Program and is designed to provide current demographic, social, economic, and housing estimates throughout the decade. Table DP03 provides socioeconomic characteristics such as unemployment, occupation and industry type, number of households by income bracket, number of people by health insurance coverage type, and numbers living under the poverty level.
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2010, "American Community Survey 2015 5yr estimates - SELECTED ECONOMIC CHARACTERISTICS", https://factfinder.census.gov/faces/nav/jsf/pages/download_center.xhtml#none, US Census Bureau American FactFinder [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
Cross walk of 2010 Census Blocks to Census Places for the state of Illinois. Geographic data here has been pulled from the 2010 Census Block Assignment Files dataset.


Block Assignment Files (BAFs) have been created for each of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, and Puerto Rico. Each file contains 2010 Census tabulation block codes and geographic area codes for a specific geographic entity type. Each BAF contains every block within the given state, even if the block is not within one of the geographic areas represented in the file. For those blocks where no geographic area is present, the block is listed, followed by one or more commas (depending on the file layout for the specific geographic area type).
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2010, "2010 Census Block Assignment Files - Incorporated places / census designated places - Illinois", https://www.census.gov/geo/maps-data/data/baf.html, United States Census Bureau [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
A lookup table from Census Blocks to multiple other Census geographic entities, as listed in the data dictionary. This is the geographic crosswalk file for Kansas and is in the public schema of the "appliedda" database with the name "lodes_census_geography_crosswalk_ks".


The primary key/identifier in the Geography Crosswalk is the 2010 Census Tabulation Block Code (tabblk2010). This code does not change between Decennial Censuses and can be used to link to the geocodes in the Origin-Destination/Residential Area Characteristics/Workplace Area Characteristics files as well as other datasets which include fields that resolve to Census geography entities. All other geographic codes in the crosswalk are “current” and represent the most recent definitions of the legal, statistical, or administrative areas as integrated into LODES and OnTheMap.
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2018, "LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics (LODES) Census Geography Crosswalk - Kansas", https://lehd.ces.census.gov/data/lodes/LODES7/ks/ks_xwalk.csv.gz, US Census Bureau [Distributor], 1 [Version]

soc_code.description: SOC code - Occupational codes are based on the Standard Occupational Classifcation (SOC) 2010 coding structure.  Detailed information regarding the structure can be found at - http://www.bls.gov/soc/ and in the included documentation: soc_2010_user_guide.pdf.

title.description: Occupation title from the Standard Occupational Classification (SOC) User Guide.

annual_wages_2013_experienced.description: Experienced annual wages 2013. The mean (average) of the top two-thirds of wages in an occupation.

annual_wages_2013_entry.description: Entry annual wages 2013. The mean (average) of the bottom third of wages in an occupation.

change_net.description: Actual change in the number of workers employed in an industry or occupation between base year and projected year.

training_needed.description: Typical on-the-job training needed to attain competency in the occupation. U.S. Department of Labor (USDOL), Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), Employment Projections, Measures of Education and Training technical documentation is found at http://www.bls.gov/emp/ep_education_tech.htm and included here as ep_education_tech.pdf. BLS assigns occupations to a designation within three categories: typical entry-level education, related work experience, and typical on-the-job training.

change_percent.description: Percentage change in the number of workers employed in an industry or occupation between base year and projected year.

typical_entry_education.description: Typical education needed for entry. U.S. Department of Labor (USDOL), Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), Employment Projections, Measures of Education and Training technical documentation is found at http://www.bls.gov/emp/ep_education_tech.htm and included here as ep_education_tech.pdf. BLS assigns occupations to a designation within three categories: typical entry-level education, related work experience, and typical on-the-job training.

annual_avg_openings_total.description: Annual number of job openings expected in an occupation due to growth plus replacement need.

annual_wages_2013_mean.description: Mean annual wages 2013. Employment and wage data by occupation are based on the Occupational Employment Statistics (OES) survey, which collects information from approximately 52,000 businesses. Data were collected in 2009, 2010, 2011 and 2012 and then updated to the first quarter of 2013 by making cost-of-living adjustments. These wage estimates reflect New York States minimum wage of $7.25, the minimum wage in effect at the time these estimates were prepared. Occupational employment and wages technical documentation is found at http://labor.ny.gov/stats/lstechoes.shtm and is included here as lstechoes.pdf.

employment_2013.description: Base year number of workers employed in occupation for second quarter 2013.

annual_avg_openings_growth.description: Openings in an occupation due to industry expansion and the consequent need for additional workers.

annual_avg_openings_replacement.description: Calculated by weighing the number of people exiting the occupation against the number of people entering the occupation by age group. This net measurement is best for quantifying how many new people are needed to enter a given occupation, and, if training is required, to identify its minimum training requirements.

employment_2015.description: Projected year number of workers employed in occupation for second quarter 2015.

work_experience.description: Work experience in a related occupation. U.S. Department of Labor (USDOL), Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), Employment Projections, Measures of Education and Training technical documentation is found at http://www.bls.gov/emp/ep_education_tech.htm and included here as ep_education_tech.pdf. BLS assigns occupations to a designation within three categories: typical entry-level education, related work experience, and typical on-the-job training.

training_needed.description: Typical on-the-job training needed to attain competency in the occupation. U.S. Department of Labor (USDOL), Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), Employment Projections, Measures of Education and Training technical documentation is found at http://www.bls.gov/emp/ep_education_tech.htm and included here as ep_education_tech.pdf. BLS assigns occupations to a designation within three categories: typical entry-level education, related work experience, and typical on-the-job training.

change_percent.description: Percentage change in the number of workers employed in an industry or occupation between base year and projected year.

typical_entry_education.description: Typical education needed for entry. U.S. Department of Labor (USDOL), Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), Employment Projections, Measures of Education and Training technical documentation is found at http://www.bls.gov/emp/ep_education_tech.htm and included here as ep_education_tech.pdf. BLS assigns occupations to a designation within three categories: typical entry-level education, related work experience, and typical on-the-job training.

annual_avg_openings_total.description: Annual number of job openings expected in an occupation due to growth plus replacement need.

annual_wages_2013_mean.description: Mean annual wages 2013. Employment and wage data by occupation are based on the Occupational Employment Statistics (OES) survey, which collects information from approximately 52,000 businesses. Data were collected in 2009, 2010, 2011 and 2012 and then updated to the first quarter of 2013 by making cost-of-living adjustments. These wage estimates reflect New York States minimum wage of $7.25, the minimum wage in effect at the time these estimates were prepared. Occupational employment and wages technical documentation is found at http://labor.ny.gov/stats/lstechoes.shtm and is included here as lstechoes.pdf.

employment_2013.description: Base year number of workers employed in occupation for second quarter 2013.

annual_avg_openings_growth.description: Openings in an occupation due to industry expansion and the consequent need for additional workers.

annual_avg_openings_replacement.description: Calculated by weighing the number of people exiting the occupation against the number of people entering the occupation by age group. This net measurement is best for quantifying how many new people are needed to enter a given occupation, and, if training is required, to identify its minimum training requirements.

employment_2015.description: Projected year number of workers employed in occupation for second quarter 2015.

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
Short-term industry and occupational estimates and projections are presented for New York State and its ten labor market regions. Projections are used for assessing short-range trends in occupational employment and resulting occupational opportunities. The projections process consists of four principal phases:


1) Developing industry employment totals for the base year and industry employment estimates for the projected year. Projected year estimates are a function of national, state and local area variables including industry employment, industry indicators and labor force data.


2) Collecting and analyzing Occupational Employment Statistics (OES) program survey data from 52,000 New York employers on how many individuals they employ in each occupation. The results generate an occupational distribution or staffing pattern for each industry.


3) Applying occupational staffing patterns from the OES survey to the industry employment totals to produce base year occupational employment estimates. In turn, expected staffing pattern changes are applied to the base year pattern.  The modified staffing patterns are then applied to projected industry employment levels to obtain projected occupational employment levels.
    

4) Applying replacement rates to the projected occupational employment levels and adding growth to obtain estimates of occupational openings for approximately 800 specific occupations.
fields.source_archive: New York State Department of Labor, Division of Research & Statistics
fields.dataset_citation: New York State Department of Labor, 2013, "New York State Short-Term Occupational Employment Projections, 2013-2015", https://www.labor.ny.gov/stats/2013-2015-short-term-occupational-projections-Regional.xls, New York State Department of Labor [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: Charter Schools. This layer contains points representing locations for charter schools, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. School locations were identified from public records and heads-up digitized from the 2010 orthophotographs. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE.
fields.dataset_citation: DC Public Charter School Board, 2016, "Charter Schools", https://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=a3832935b1d644e48c887e6ec5a65fcd, District of Columbia Open Data [Distributor], 1 [Version]

si.description: State financed health insurance plan other than Medicaid

ss.description: Sliding fee scale (fee is based on income and other factors)

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
Location of Substance Abuse treatment facilities in the state of Illinois. Locations are published by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) through their Behavioral Health Treatment Services Locator. The Behavioral Health Treatment Services Locator is an online source of information for persons seeking treatment facilities in the United States or U.S. Territories for substance abuse/addiction and/or mental health problems.

The Behavioral Health Treatment Services Locator is a product of SAMHSA's Center for Behavioral Health Statistics and Quality (CBHSQ). The Locator is compiled from responses to CBHSQ's annual surveys of treatment facilities (the National Survey of Substance Abuse Treatment Services and the National Mental Health Services Survey).

In response to the growing demand for treatment services, and to increase the visibility of treatment service providers, SAMHSA is sharing facility contact information from its Behavioral Health Treatment Services Locator with commercially available search engines to help facilitate greater access to mental health and substance use treatment services. Facility contact information only includes the facility's name, location address, phone number, and web site.
fields.dataset_citation: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA), 2017, "Substance Abuse Treatment Facilities in Illinois", https://findtreatment.samhsa.gov/locator?sAddr=&submit=Go, Behavioral Health Treatement Services Locator [Distributor], 1 [Version]

uiacct.description: Unemployment Insurance account number for employer (hashed)

egr.description: Indiana-based economic growth region (EGR) of employer, based on county of employer. Lookup file countyfips_regions_lookup.csv details which counties belong to which economic growth region

ssn.description: Social security number of the employee (hashed)

wages.description: Wage amount for each employee per employer per quarter

cnty.description: County of employer in Indiana. Lookup file for this field is countyfips_regions_lookup.csv, matching from field cnty to field CountyFIPS

naics_3_digit.description: 3-digit industry NAICS code of employer. Lookup file for this field is naics_codes.csv, matching from field naics_3_digit to field NAICS3_Code

fields.access_requirements: Dataset may only be accessed and used by members of the Applied Data Analytics course using these data.
fields.description: Wage records for each person by quarter by employer.  This set is created to examine workforce outcomes for students K-12, higher education, unemployment claimants returning to work, and our DWD customers receiving services from our local offices.  This data set includes:  social security number, year/quarter that the wage was earned, Unemployment Insurance (UI) account number, Federal Identification Employer Number (FEIN), wages earned from the employer, 3-digit industry NAICS code, county and Indiana economic growth region of employer.  Data is gathered from employers' UC-5 quarterly tax filings.
fields.dataset_citation: Indiana Department of Workforce Development (DWD), 2019, "Indiana wage records by employer 2005-2018", Applied Data Analytics Course [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: The American Community Survey (ACS) is part of the U.S. Census Bureau's Decennial Census Program and is designed to provide current demographic, social, economic, and housing estimates throughout the decade. Table DP03 provides socioeconomic characteristics such as unemployment, occupation and industry type, number of households by income bracket, number of people by health insurance coverage type, and numbers living under the poverty level.
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2010, "American Community Survey 2015 5yr estimates - SELECTED ECONOMIC CHARACTERISTICS", https://factfinder.census.gov/faces/nav/jsf/pages/download_center.xhtml#none, US Census Bureau American FactFinder [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.data_usage_policy: This dataset is intended for public access and use.
fields.data_steward_organization: Center for Urban Science and Progress (CUSP)
fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: Homeless Facility and Service locations. The dataset contains locations and attributes of Homeless Facility and Service locations, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. A database provided by Answers Please and The InterFaith Conference of Metropolitan Washington identified emergency food, shelter and health care locations. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.
fields.dataset_citation: Answers Please, InterFaith Conference of Metropolitan Washington, Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments, United Way of The National Capital Area, 2017, "Homeless Service Facilities", https://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=47be87a68e7a4376a3bdbe15d85de398, District of Columbia Open Data [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: MIssouri state LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics (LODES) used by OnTheMap are available for download below. Version 7 of LODES was enumerated by 2010 census blocks. Previous versions of LODES were enumerated with 2000 census blocks. Data files are state-based and organized into three types: Origin-Destination (OD), Residence Area Characteristics (RAC), and Workplace Area Characteristics (WAC), all at census block geographic detail. Data is available for most states for the years 2002-2015.
fields.source_archive: Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics Origin-Destination Employee Statistics

Capacity.description: The capacity or service volume for the facility, program, or parkland property.

PKtoG8.description: Total enrollment of the school (pre- kindergarten through grade 8).

SGroupType.description: A code identifying a subgroup of facilities within a group type.

BBL.description: A concatenation of the borough code, tax block and tax lot of the facility, program, or parkland property.

XCoord.description: The X coordinate of the XY coordinate pair which depicts the approximate location of the facility, program, or parkland property.

Tract2010.description: The 2010 census tract in which the facility or program is located in (for mapping selection).

PolicePrct.description: The police precinct of the facility or program.

FacName.description: The name of the facility, program, or parkland property.

TaxLot.description: The tax lot of the facility, program, or parkland property.

HealthArea.description: The health area of the facility or program.

CDName.description: A string of text specifying the borough and community district or joint interest area where the facility, program, or parkland property is located in.

AgencyOper.description: A code identifying the agency which operates the facility, program, or parkland property.

SvcArea.description: A code identifying the extent of the areas the facility, program, or parkland property serves.

AgencyOver.description: A code identifying the agency responsible for the oversight of the facility, program, or parkland property.

TaxBlock.description: The tax block of the facility, program, or parkland property.

CapType.description: A code identifying the specific unit of measure of the facility, program, or parkland property's use.

FacAddress.description: The address or location of the facility, program, or parkland property.

CD.description: The community district or joint interest area in which the facility, program, or parkland property is located in.

fields.data_usage_policy: This dataset is intended for public access and use.
fields.data_steward_organization: Center for Urban Science and Progress (CUSP)
fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: To improve access to capital, the City of Chicago seeded a $2MM revolving loan fund and partnered with Accion to create the Chicago Microlending Institute (CMI). CMI helped train two new local microlenders, Chicago Neighborhood Initiatives (CNI) and Women's Business Development Corporation (WBDC), to help connect small businesses around the city to affordable access to capital. These microloans vary in size from $500 to $25,000 and the average loan size is around $10,000. This dataset reflects the lender, location, business industry, and borrower demographics for small businesses supported by the City's revolving loan fund. Certain data elements could not be included on a per-loan basis for privacy reasons but are summarized in the https://data.cityofchicago.org/id/4s8s-adbr dataset.
fields.source_archive: City of Chicago Open Data Portal
fields.dataset_citation: City of Chicago, 2016, "Chicago Microlending Institute (CMI) Microloans", https://data.cityofchicago.org/resource/dpkg-upyz, City of Chicago Open Data Portal [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.description:
Kansas City Police Department Crime data as collected from the Kansas City Missouri open data portal for the years 2009-April 2018 and compiled into a single dataset.



This is the most current information as of the date of upload. This provides the user the ability to view the most current crime information within Kansas City, Missouri. The displayed information is the most current information from the data source as of the date of upload. The data source is dynamic and therefore constantly changing. Changes to the information may occur, as incident information is refined. While the Board of Police Commissioners of Kansas City, Missouri (Board) makes every effort to maintain and distribute accurate information, no warranties and/or representations of any kind are made regarding information, data or services provided. The Board is not responsible for misinterpretation of this information and makes no inference or judgment as to the relative safety to any particular area or neighborhood. In no event shall the Board be liable in any way to the users of this data. Users of this data shall hold the Board harmless in all matters and accounts arising from the use and/or accuracy of this data.
fields.dataset_citation: Board of Police Commissioners of Kansas City, Missouri, 2018, "Kansas City Police Department Crime Data 2009-2018", http://www.kansascity.com/, The Kansas City Star [Distributor], 1 [Version]

wage.description: Hashed Quarterly Wages: Hashed copy of the total amount of wages (both taxable and non-taxable) paid to the Reference Worker during the entire reference quarter that are subject to Unemployment Insurance taxes. The wages for all worksites should match the wages paid that are reported on that States' Quarterly Contribution Report. If no wages were paid, zero fill. Round to the nearest dollar (Omit cents).

empr_no.description: Hashed UI Account Number: State Employment Security Agency Identification number for the employer (U-I account). Note: as a new UI Account number format was used starting 2016 Quarter 3, the UI Account numbers for this year and quarter will not match with UI Account numbers (ui_acct) in the employers table (kcmo_lehd.mo_qcew_employers). In order to properly match these entities, you will want to use the kcmo_lehd.ui_acct_xwalk table. The values for ui_acct in mo_qcew_employers 2016q3 will match to the ui_acct_xwalk variable legacy_ean_7_nocheck and the wage ui account variable will match to the ui_acct_xwalk variable ui_ean.

seinunit.description: Reporting Unit Number. Zero if unknown. Only available in wage data for Minnesota state.

hours.description: Hours worked in the quarter, if available. Zero if unavailable. Only available in Texas and Wisconsin states.

state.description: Reference State: 2-digit FIPS State code for the location of the establishment.  (See http://129.6.13.40:80/fipspubs/co-codes/states.htm).

year.description: Reference Year. Four digits of the calendar year covered by the report.

weeks.description: Weeks worked in the quarter, if available. Zero if unavailable. Only available in Texas and Wisconsin states.

quarter.description: Reference Quarter: Quarter identification number within the data year, "1"=First calendar quarter (January to March), "2"=second calendar quarter (April to June), "3"=Third calendar quarter (July to September), "4"=Fourth calendar quarter (October to December)

sum_wage_qttile.description: Percentile value of total earnings for all individuals for the year and quarter

job_qtile.description: Percentile value of the number of jobs held by all individuals for the year and quarter

pctile.description: Percentile label (1-100) for they year and quarter

year.description: Reference Year. Four digits of the calendar year covered by the report.

avg_wage_qtile.description: Percentile value of average earnings for all individuals for he year and quarter

quarter.description: Reference Quarter: Quarter identification number within the data year, "1"=First calendar quarter (January to March), "2"=second calendar quarter (April to June), "3"=Third calendar quarter (July to September), "4"=Fourth calendar quarter (October to December)

fields.access_requirements: You must be enrolled in an ADRF class to access these data.
fields.description:
Quarterly records of wages for every job held by each person in the state of Missouri from 2006 to 2016. This data is derived from the Missouri state Unemployment Insurance (UI) wage file that is supplied to the United States Census Bureau for use in producing Quarterly Workforce Indicators (QWI).


The mo_wage_percentile table provides the quarterly percentile values of the number of jobs, average earnings, and total earnings for employees' covered sector jobs across the state of MO by year and quarte. These data are derived from the kcmo_lehd.mo_wage table for the years 2006- 2016. The code used to create this table is provided in the create-mo-wage-percentiles.ipynb notebook. Data usage example: for all the people employed in a covered sector in MO in 2008q2, the median value of the number of jobs would be found in column "job_qtile" where the row is year=2008, q=2, and pctile=50


The summary of this dataset’s fields is a sample of records only. Please access the full dataset in the partitioned course database table: kcmo_lehd.mo_wage.
fields.dataset_citation: Missouri Office of Administration, US Census Bureau, 2018, "Missouri Unemployment Insurance (UI) wage 2006-2017", Applied Data Analytics Course [Distributor], 2 [Version]

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
A lookup table from Census Blocks to multiple other Census geographic entities, as listed in the data dictionary. This is the geographic crosswalk file for Illinois and is in the public schema of the "appliedda" database with the name "lodes_census_geography_crosswalk_il".


The primary key/identifier in the Geography Crosswalk is the 2010 Census Tabulation Block Code (tabblk2010). This code does not change between Decennial Censuses and can be used to link to the geocodes in the Origin-Destination/Residential Area Characteristics/Workplace Area Characteristics files as well as other datasets which include fields that resolve to Census geography entities. All other geographic codes in the crosswalk are “current” and represent the most recent definitions of the legal, statistical, or administrative areas as integrated into LODES and OnTheMap.
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2016, "LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics (LODES) Census Geography Crosswalk - Illinois", https://lehd.ces.census.gov/data/lodes/LODES7/il/il_xwalk.csv.gz, US Census Bureau [Distributor], 2 [Version]

Data compiled about fatal police shootings in the United States from FatalEncounters.org, the U.S. Police Shootings Database and KilledbyPolice.net. The data are presented and available for download from mappingpoliceviolence.org. Population data from the US Census Bureau American Community Survey is also included in report tables.

Additional dataset information can be found in: mapping_police_violence_about_the_data.pdf

fields.description: The Demographic Profile Summary File contains 100 percent data asked of all people and about every housing unit on topics such as sex, age, race, Hispanic or Latino origin, household relationship, householdtype, group quarters population, housing occupancy, and housing tenure.

fields.description: Community Facilities (Centers) that are on NYCHA property with programs either sponsored by NYCHA or by a non-NYCHA entity. All programs are open to the public. fields.description:
A lookup table from Census Blocks to multiple other Census geographic entities, as listed in the data dictionary. This is the geographic crosswalk file for Missouri and is in the public schema of the "appliedda" database with the name "lodes_census_geography_crosswalk_mo".


The primary key/identifier in the Geography Crosswalk is the 2010 Census Tabulation Block Code (tabblk2010). This code does not change between Decennial Censuses and can be used to link to the geocodes in the Origin-Destination/Residential Area Characteristics/Workplace Area Characteristics files as well as other datasets which include fields that resolve to Census geography entities. All other geographic codes in the crosswalk are “current” and represent the most recent definitions of the legal, statistical, or administrative areas as integrated into LODES and OnTheMap.
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2018, "LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics (LODES) Census Geography Crosswalk - Missouri", https://lehd.ces.census.gov/data/lodes/LODES7/mo/mo_xwalk.csv.gz, US Census Bureau [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.description: Human Services Facilities - DC Answers Please Program. The dataset contains locations and attributes of Human Services Facilities, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. A database provided by the DC Department of Human Services (DHS) identified Human Services Facilities and DC GIS staff geo-processed the data. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE.

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
Data for persons or businesses with a current business license with the City of Kansas City, Missouri. Includes business licenses from 2013-2018


All persons (sole proprietors, partnerships, and corporations) who conduct business in Kansas City, Mo., must obtain a business license for that activity. A license is valid for the calendar year in which it is issued. Business licenses expire on Dec. 31 of each year.


The source where this data comes from is updated weekly and provides only current-year business license information for businesses that are considered “currently licensed” by the City of Kansas City, Missouri. “Currently licensed” means the business has been issued a business license for the current year.


This dataset is located in the database at "public.mo_business_licenses"
fields.source_archive: Kansas City Business License Search Tool
fields.dataset_citation: City of Kansas City, 2018, "Kansas City, Missouri Business Licenses", http://city.kcmo.org/kc/BusinessLicenseSearch, City of Kansas City [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.title: Missouri Department of Corrections (DOC) - Classes
fields.data_usage_policy: These data are being provided for educational purposes for use in Applied Data Analytics program. Dataset may only be accessed and used by ADRF users who are members of a course using these data.
fields.data_steward_organization: Coleridge Initiative

last_name.description: DOC Last Name. Offenders may have multiple names, deidentified

sentlength.description: Most serious sentence length, years. Life sentences have been converted to 30 years. Offenders with a suspended imposition probation  and serving a 120-day sentence have no sentence

educ_score.description:
Last educational attainment. Education attainment is verified and based upon testing on admission.  Offeners that do not have a high school diploma are requiored to make a good fasith effort to obtain a High School Equivalency diploma.


1=High School Diploma/HSE
2=9-12th grade
3=6-8th grade
4=4-5th grade
5=0-3rd grade
N=No assessment

msoffnse.description: Most serious offense on the incarceration cycle. DOC charge code and offense description

lstcustody.description:
Last assigned custody level. All offenders are expected to be C-1 at the time of release.  Only offenders who have poor institutional behavior or offenders required to be held until sentence completion  will be C-2 or C-5


C-1=Low custody
C-2=Medium custody
C-5=maximum security

mve_job.description:
Worked in a MVE factory during incarceration. If Education = 1, good institutional behavior and serving long sentence


Y=yes
N=No

vocat_score.description:
Last vocational score. Only enroll in vocational classes if education score = 1


1=Trained & skilled
2=Skilled
3=Semi-skilled
4=Unskilled
5=No skills or training
N=No assessment

admstat.description:
Status on admission. New court commitments and probation revocations are called new admissions because it is the first admission to prison.


NA=New court commitment
PB=Probation revocation
BP=Parole violator

doc_id.description: Unique DOC identifier. Used to associate to the social security numbers in the NYU SSN DOC file

first_name.description: DOC First Name. in official databases, deidentified

doccycex.description: join key for NYU DOC Classes. Concatenation of doc_id cycle and exit date. Use to associate the classes and programs that were completed in each incarceration

sentdate.description: Court Sentence date. Most serious offense

sf_cat.description:
Last salient factor or violator salient factor risk assessment category. (Risk of re-offending). Offenders serving a 120-day or other court stipulated sentences do not have a risk assessment


EXC=Excellent (Lowest risk) 
ABV=Above average
AVE=Average
BEL=Below average
POR=Poor (Highest risk)
NA=No assessment

work_release.description:
Worked outside of prison during incarceration. Only allowed if C-1, Education = 1 and good behavior


Y=yes
N=No

medical_score.description:
Last medical score


1=No problems
2=Routine sick calls
3=Daily nursing
4=24 hour nursing
5=Residential unit
N=No assessment

felonyclass.description:
Class of the offense.  Offenders can be serving multiple sentences, most a consecutibve. The felony class determines the sentence range. A is the most serious (10 years to life)  and E the least serious(1 to 4 years). U is unclassifed because the sentencing range does not fit a particular felony class.  Most unclassified felonies are serious sex offenses.


A=A Class Felony
B=B Class Felony
C=C Class Felony
D=D Class Felony
E=E Class Felony
U=Unclassified

admtype.description:
Type of sentence to serve. Serve a sentence means under the jursdiction of the parole board and offenders will be released to parole. Other admision types are under the jurisdiction of the courts and will be released to probation


S=Serve a sentence
I= 120-day treatment
O=120-day shock probation
L=Long term drug
A=Sex Offender Assessment
C=Court ordered detention sanction (CODS)

mptpct.description: Minimum percentage of sentence required to serve before release, if new admission. 0, 40, 50, 80, 85. Applied to offenders with one or more prior incarcerations with the DOC (1, 2 or 3+ prior incarcerations) or convicted of a dangerous felony (85%)

inst_risk.description:
Last institutional risk score (institutional behavior and risk factors- determines custody level). Institutional risk is good institutional behavior and low risk score


1=Lowest risk
2=medium risk
5=maximum risk

saca.description:
Last substance abuse score. Substance abuse screener and used to determine need for institutional drug treatment


1=No abuse
2=Intermittent abuse, needs SA education
3=Moderate, needs short term trt.
4=significant, needs intermediate trt.
5=Severe, needs long term trt.
N=No assessment

new_sent_date.description: Date of new sentence after release. First new sentence (prison or probation)

sf_score.description: Last salient factor risk assessment score. Range -8 to +7. Low scores are low risk

ofnsgroup.description:
Offense group of the most serious offense. Used by the parole board to determine guideline time served in association with the risk score.  Offenders with violent or sex offenses are expected to serve a higher percent of the sentence before parole


Violent=Violent offense
Non-Violent=Non-violent offense
Drugs=Drug offense
DWI=Driving Under the Influence offense
SexChildAbuse=Sex Child Abuse offense

death_date.description: Death during supervision. Death only recorded if on supervision

hispanic.description:
Hispanic ethnicity = H. Self reported


H=Hispanic Origin
N=Non-Hispanic

race.description:
Black, White,Native American, Asian, Not Known. Self reported


A=Asian
B=Black
I=Native American
W=White
U=Not known

mh_score.description:
Last mental health score. Not mental illness diagnosos but 3 or higher have a mental illness.


1=No problems
2=Mild impairment
3=Clinic care / medication
4=Serious functional impairment
5=Severe functional impairment
N=No assessment

pris_ret_date.description: Date of next prison entry. First return to prison for violation of supervision or new sentence.  Used as recidivism measure.

noparole.description:
Years to serve before parole, if new admission. 1-50 years


999=Life, no parole

rlsetype.description:
Type of release. Database includes only offenders released to supervision or on completion of sentence


PPR=Parole
MXR=Discharge
CDR=Conditional Release
PRB=Probation

dischdate.description: Completion date of most serious sentence

fields.title: 2015 - 2016 New York City Community Health Profiles and Intimate Partner Violence Data
fields.data_usage_policy: This dataset is intended for public access and use.
fields.data_steward_organization: Center for Urban Science and Progress (CUSP), NYU
fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
The primary source of the data is NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene's (DOHMH) Community Health Profiles (2015). The open data can be accessed on this website: https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/data/data-publications/profiles.page. The secondary source of the data is the The Mayor's Office to Combat Domestic Violence (OCDV) 2016 Intimate Partner Violence Snapshots. The data can be access in this report: http://www1.nyc.gov/assets/ocdv/downloads/pdf/2016-IPV-Snapshot-Book.pdf 


Five columns of data from the OCDV snapshots were added to the open datasheet from DOHMH based on NYC Community Board Districts as present in the DOHMH Community Health Profile data.


Together these data include demographics, vital statistics, health indicators, and intimate partner violence crime statistics by NYC Community Board District.
fields.dataset_citation:
NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene's (DOHMH), NYC Mayor's Office to Combat Domestic Violence (OCDV), 2016, "2015 - 2016 New York City Community Health Profiles and Intimate Partner Violence Data", https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/data/data-publications/profiles.page &
http://www1.nyc.gov/assets/ocdv/downloads/pdf/2016-IPV-Snapshot-Book.pdf, NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene's (DOHMH) & NYC Mayor's Office to Combat Domestic Violence (OCDV) [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
A lookup table from Census Blocks to multiple other Census geographic entities, as listed in the data dictionary. This is the geographic crosswalk file for New York State and is in the public schema of the "appliedda" database with the name "ny_xwalk". 


The primary key/identifier in the Geography Crosswalk is the 2010 Census Tabulation Block Code (tabblk2010). This code does not change between Decennial Censuses and can be used to link to the geocodes in the Origin-Destination/Residential Area Characteristics/Workplace Area Characteristics files as well as other datasets which include fields that resolve to Census geography entities. All other geographic codes in the crosswalk are “current” and represent the most recent definitions of the legal, statistical, or administrative areas as integrated into LODES and OnTheMap.
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2016, "LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics (LODES) Census Geography Crosswalk - New York", https://lehd.ces.census.gov/data/lodes/LODES7/ny/ny_xwalk.csv.gz, US Census Bureau [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: Illinois state LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics (LODES) used by OnTheMap are available for download below. Version 7 of LODES was enumerated by 2010 census blocks. Previous versions of LODES were enumerated with 2000 census blocks. Data files are state-based and organized into three types: Origin-Destination (OD), Residence Area Characteristics (RAC), and Workplace Area Characteristics (WAC), all at census block geographic detail. Data is available for most states for the years 2002-2014.
fields.source_archive: Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics Origin-Destination Employee Statistics
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2014, "Illinois State Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics Origin-Destination Employment Statistics - Workplace Area Characteristics", https://lehd.ces.census.gov/data/lodes/LODES7, US Census Bureau [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.data_usage_policy: These data are being provided for educational purposes for use in Applied Data Analytics program. Dataset may only be accessed and used by ADRF users who are members of a course using these data.
fields.data_steward_organization: Coleridge Initiative

quarter.description:
Quarter of wage record


1=1st calendar quarter (January-March)
2=2nd calendar quarter (April to June)
3=3rd calendar quarter (July to September)
4=4th calendar quarter (October to December)

ssn.description: Social security number of the employee (hashed)

sumwages.description: Wage sum for each employee in the given quarter

ctemps.description: Total number of each employers per quarter

fields.access_requirements: Dataset may only be accessed and used by members of the Applied Data Analytics course using these data.
fields.description: Wage sums and number of employers' for each person by quarter.  This set is created to examine workforce outcomes for students K-12, higher education, unemployment claimants returning to work, and our DWD customers receiving services from our local offices.  This data set includes:  social security number, year/quarter that the wage was earned, wage sum, and number of employers.  Data is gathered from employers UC-5 quarterly tax filings.
fields.dataset_citation: Indiana Department of Workforce Development (DWD), 2019, "Indiana wage records by quarter 2005-2018", Applied Data Analytics Course [Distributor], 1 [Version]

ZoneMap.description: The Department of City Planning Zoning Map Number associated with the tax lot's X and Y Coordinates.

FactryArea.description: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for factory purposes.

Tract2010.description: The 2000 census tract that the tax lot is located in.

ZMCode.description: A code associated with the Zoning Map # to identify Tax Lots on the border of more than one Zoning Map.

BsmtCode.description: A code indicating the type of basement and the basement grade

FacilFAR.description: The Maximum Allowable Facility Floor Area Ratio for this lot.

NumFloors.description: In the primary building on the tax lot, the number of full and partial stories starting from the ground floor.

HealthArea.description: The health area the tax lot is located in.

CondoNo.description: The condominium number assigned to the complex by the Department of Finance.

Easements.description: The number of easements on the tax lot.

LotArea.description: Total area of the tax lot.

Version.description: The Version Number related to the release of PLUTO.

XCoord.description: The X coordinate of the XY coordinate pair which depicts the approximate location of the lot.

Lot.description: The number of the tax lot.

BldgFront.description: The frontage of the primary building on the tax lot.

ResArea.description: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for residential purposes.

UnitsRes.description: The sum of residential units in all buildings on the tax lot.

ResidFAR.description: The Maximum Allowable Residential Floor Area Ratio for this lot.

SanitDistrict.description: The Sanitation District that the tax lot is in.

BuiltFAR.description: The total gross building floor area divided by the area of the tax lot.

YearAlter1.description: If only one alteration then the year of the most recent alteration; otherwise the year of the second most recent alteration.

BldgClass.description: A code for the major use on the tax lot.

PolicePrct.description: The police precinct the tax lot is located in.

AssessLand.description: The actual assessed land value for FY 2015.

SanitSub.description: The Sanitation Subsection that the tax lot is in.

OwnerType.description: A code indicating the type of ownership for the tax lot.

NumBldgs.description: The number of buildings on the tax lot.

FireComp.description: The fire company that services the tax lot.

CommFAR.description: The Maximum Allowable Commercial Floor Area Ratio for this lot.

Block.description: The tax block the tax lot is located in.

AreaSource.description: A code indicating the source file that was used to determine the tax lot's Total Building Floor Area.

Address.description: An address for the tax lot.

SanitBoro.description: The Sanitation Borough that the tax lot is in.

Overlay1.description: The commercial overlay assigned to the tax lot.

Overlay2.description: The commercial overlay occupying the second greatest percentage of the tax lot's area.

SplitZone.description: A code indicating whether the tax lot is split by one or more zoning boundaries.

OwnerName.description: The name of the owner of the tax lot.

ExemptLand.description: The actual exempt land value for FY 2015.

BldgDepth.description: The depth of the primary building on the tax lot.

BBL.description: A concatenation of the borough, tax block and the corresponding tax lot.

GarageArea.description: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for garage purposes.

CB2010.description: The 2010 census block the tax lot is located in.

IrrLotCode.description: A code indicating whether the tax lot is irregularly shaped.

EDesigNum.description: The E-Designation number associated with the tax lot.

PLUTOMapID.description: A code indicating whether the tax lot is from the PLUTO file and/or the DTM Clipped to the Shoreline File and/or the DTM File.

CD.description: The community district or joint interest area the tax lot is located in.

ZoneDist3.description: The zoning classification occupying the third greatest percentage of the tax lot's area.

ZoneDist2.description: The zoning classification occupying the second greatest percentage of the tax lot's area.

ZoneDist1.description: The zoning district classification of the tax lot.

ComArea.description: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for commercial purposes.

OtherArea.description: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for uses other than Residential, Office, Retail, Garage, Storage or Factory purposes.

YearAlter2.description: If more than one alteration then the year of the most recent alteration otherwise blank.

ZoneDist4.description: The zoning classification occupying the fourth greatest percentage of the tax lot's area.

Landmark.description: The name of an individual landmark, landmark site or an interior landmark.

AssessTot.description: The actual assessed total value for FY 2015.

LtdHeight.description: The limited height district assigned to the tax lot.

SchoolDist.description: The community school district the tax lot is located in.

TaxMap.description: The Department of Finance tax map number associated with the tax block and lot.

LandUse.description: A code for the predominant land use on the tax lot.

Sanborn.description: The Sanborn Map Company map number associated with the tax block and lot.

YCoord.description: The Y coordinate of the XY coordinate pair which depicts the approximate location of the lot.

BoroCode.description: A borough code representing the borough the tax lot is located in.

LotType.description: A code indicating the geographic location of one lot to another and/or to the water.

StrgeArea.description: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for storage/loft purposes.

HistDist.description: The name of the Historic District as designated by the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission.

ZipCode.description: The zip code the tax lot is located in.

APPBBL.description: The originating Borough, Tax Block and Tax Lot from the apportionment prior to the merge, split or property's conversion to a condominium.

CT2010.description: The 2010 census tract the tax lot is located in.

ExemptTot.description: The actual exempt total value for FY 2015.

RetailArea.description: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for retail purposes.

Council.description: The city council district the tax lot is located in.

OfficeArea.description: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for office purposes.

UnitsTotal.description: The sum of residential and non-residential (offices, retail stores, etc,) units in all buildings on the tax lot.

YearBuilt.description: The year construction of the building was completed.

Ext.description: A code identifying whether there is an extension or free standing structure on the lot which is not the primary structure

Borough.description: The borough abbreviation for the borough the tax lot is located in.

ProxCode.description: The physical relationship of the building to neighboring buildings.

SPDist1.description: The special purpose assigned to the tax lot.

SPDist2.description: The special purpose occupying the second greatest percentage of the tax lot's area.

SPDist3.description: The special purpose occupying the third greatest percentage of the tax lot's area.

fields.title: Kansas City Missouri census tracts with flag for East or West of Troost Street
fields.data_usage_policy: This dataset is intended for public access and use.
fields.data_steward_organization: Center for Urban Science and Progress (CUSP), NYU

location.description:
Flag for whether tract is east or west of Troost St., Kansas City, MO


1=East of Troost St.
2=West of Troost St.

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: Coded census tracts for Kansas City, Missouri by which side of Troost St (the historic redlining divide) they were on. This is rerecorded under the location field (1 = East of Troost St, 0 = West of Troost St). I determined the study area boundaries by the state line (west), the Blue River (east), the I-435 (south), and the Missouri River (north). Tracts that Troost ran through and those that primarily contained parks, industry, or other non-business uses are excluded.

fields.title: Missouri Department of Labor and Industrial Relations (DOLIR) Unemployment Insurance Claims
fields.data_usage_policy: These data are being provided for educational purposes for use in Applied Data Analytics program. Dataset may only be accessed and used by ADRF users who are members of a course using these data.
fields.data_steward_organization: Coleridge Initiative

fips_county_code.description: FIPS code corresponding to the claimant's count of residence (for MO residents)

exhaustee.description:
Has the claimant exhausted the claim? (received all benefits entitled to)


Y=Yes
N=No

total_base_period_wages.description: Total wages earned during the 12 month base period used to determine eligibility for unemployment claim

first_day_worked.description: Date the claimant began work with the last employer

mba.description: Maximum Benefit Amount claimant is entitled to for the claim year

last_day_worked.description: Date the claimant last worked for the most recent  employer

claim_file_date.description: Date the unemployment claim was filed

education.description:
CLDG=college degree
High School=high school diploma or GED
HSDP=high school plus additional vocational or college hours
NHSD=No high school diploma
PBCD=post bachelors degree

categories.label: high school plus additional vocational or college hours

claim_id.description: Unique identifier for each unemployment claim filed.

bye_date.description: Ending date of the Unemployment Claim

occupation_code.description: Standard Occupational Code for claimant's most recent employment

byb_date.description: Benefit Year Beginning Date - Effective Date of the Claim

employment_service_completed.description:
Did claimant participate in Reemployment Service


1=Yes
0=No

recall_date.description: A claiamant who has a definite date to return to work with his/her most recent employer may be granted a waiver from work search requirements

separation_reason.description:
Reason for separation from the Last Employer


DCFI=Discharged/Fired
LEOA=Leave of Absence
LWLO=Lack of Work/Layoff
NSEP=Not Separated
STLO=Labor Dispute (strike/lockout)
SUSP=Suspension
VOLQ=Voluntary Quit
WRPT=Working Part-time

number_of_weeks_claimed.description: Total number of weeks certified during the benefit year

employment_service_location.description: Job Center Location of Reemployment Service

claim_type.description:
Type of unemployment claim (Regular UI or Extended Benefits)


REG=Regular Unemployment
SEB=Extended Benefits
TUC=Federal Emergency Unemployment

profiling_score.description: Worker Profiling and Reemployment Services (WPRS) score used to identify claimants most likely to exhaust benefits.  Used to prioritize claimants scheduled for RESEA program

marital.description: Information not tracked.  Will be Null

non_insured_worker.description:
A claimant who does not meet the minimum monetary requirements to establish a claim is a Non-Insured Worker


Y=Non-Insured Worker
N=Insured Worker (monetarily eligible)

naics.description: Industry classification of claimant's last employer

employment_service_type.description:
Type of reemployment services claimant was selected for.  

RESEA is federal Reemployment Services and Eligibility Assessment grant program

RJS is state implemented Required Job Services Program


ER=Eligibility Review Program
REA1=RESEA
RJS=Required Job Services

race.description:
ASIA=Asian
BLCK=Black
NATV=American Indian/Alaskan Native 
PCIS=Native hawaiian/Other Pacific Islander
WHTE=White
INA=Info Not Available

employer_acct_number.description: State unemployment system Employer Account Number for the last employer

wba.description: Weekly Benefit Amount claimant is entitled to receive

occupation_description.description: Description of job corresponding to Occupation Code

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics (LODES) used by OnTheMap are available for download below. Version 7 of LODES was enumerated by 2010 census blocks. Previous versions of LODES were enumerated with 2000 census blocks. Data files are state-based and organized into three types: Origin-Destination (OD), Residence Area Characteristics (RAC), and Workplace Area Characteristics (WAC), all at census block geographic detail. Data is available for most states for the years 2002-2014.
fields.source_archive: Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics Origin-Destination Employee Statistics
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2014, "New York Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics Origin-Destination Employment Statistics - Workplace Area Characteristics - New York City", https://lehd.ces.census.gov/data/lodes/LODES7, US Census Bureau [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.data_usage_policy: All data provided here are protected under the provisions of Title 13, U.S. Code. The user shall not attempt to re-identify individuals represented in the data and agree not to disclose any data contained here to any unauthorized parties. Any analyses and data products derived from the data must be reviewed by IDES before export from this system.

location.description:
Geographic location code: The first character is always an "A," indicating an address location or "Z" indicating a zip-
centroid location.  The second character is either an "S," indicating a location on a street range or an "X," indicating a location on an intersection of two streets.  The third character is a digit, indicating other qualities about the location.

type_cov.description:
Type-of-coverage code for the quarter


0=Experience rated (contributory) (employer funded). These a should be experience-rated, assigned a standard contributions rate, or similar or special tax rate as specified in the State UI laws. Employees do not contribute to UI trust fund.
1=Reimbursable. Certain nonprofit organizations, State or local government entities, and political sub divisions which elect or are required to pay an amount of taxes into the State UI trust fund in lieu of contributions as provided in  the State UI laws.
2=Taxable (employer and employee funded).  Employers deduct contributions from the employees pay and include them with the required employer contributions. 
3=Reimbursable (employer reimburses upon demand but the employee contributes on a periodic basis).
8=Non-subject accounts. (Exclude from EQUI.)  These are accounts which do not meet UI or UCFE coverage requirements but provide data to State for other purposes.
9=Federal accounts covered under UCFE.

meei.description:
Multiple Establishment Employer Indicator (MEEI) code for the quarter. Note: observations with MEEI codes 3 will sum up to MEEI codes 2 for the same business entity. Depending on your analyses, you will want to consider filtering out one or the other so as not to duplicate records in your outputs.


1=Single establishment unit
2=Multi-unit master record
3=Subunit establishment level record for a multi-unit employer.
4=Multi-establishment employer reporting as a single unit due to unavailability of data, including refusals
5=A subunit record on the state's file that actually represents a combination of establishments. Finer level breakouts not yet available
6=Known multi establishment employer reporting as a single unit and not solicited for disaggregation because of small employment (< 10) in all secondary establishments combined

longitude.description: Geographic longitude (sign yet to be established) for the establishments physical location , with supposed precision to +/- 2 east/west measurement (+99.999999 format used blank if unknown)

rpt_unit_descr.description: Reporting unit description (intended for worksite identification, but can be used for any account)

agent_code.description: Agent code, generally used for a payroll service or other external agent who has employment and wage information for the establishment

nsta.description: NAICS code with an SIC-Treatment of Auxiliaries for the quarter

mon2_ind.description:
Indicator filed for second month's employment


Blank or R=Reported data
A=Estimated/imputed using data reported to the CES program (Discontinued after 2012)
C=Changed (re-reported)
D=Reported from missing data notice
E=Estimated/imputed single unit data. Imputed worksite data prorated from imputed master
H=Hand-imputed (vs. system generated)
K=special system-generated imputation to reflect data impacted by a catastrophe
L=Late reported (overrides prior imputation)
M=Missing data
N=Zero-filled pending resolution of long-term delinquent reporter
P=Prorated from reported parent/master to sub-unit or worksite
S=Aggregated parent/master from reported MWR or EDI data 
W=Estimated/imputed using data reported on quarterly wage records
X=Non-numeric data zero-filled pending further action

categories.label: Estimated/imputed using data reported to the CES program (Discontinued after 2012)
Estimated/imputed single unit data. Imputed worksite data prorated from imputed master
special system-generated imputation to reflect data impacted by a catastrophe
Zero-filled pending resolution of long-term delinquent reporter

Aggregated parent/master from reported MWR or EDI data
Estimated/imputed using data reported on quarterly wage records
Non-numeric data zero-filled pending further action

geo_software.description:
Indicator for the type of geocoding software used to obtain the geocoding information on an employer. values not yet determined.


G=GeoStan, the BLS used software
S=Other State-used software
Blank=if no latitude and longitude assigned

categories.label: if no latitude and longitude assigned

rpting_chng_ind.description:
Reporting change indicator, denoting whether a change to reporting status is economically based


0=Reporting is unchanged or reporting change is economically based
1=Reporting changed but change was not economically based.

categories.label: Reporting is unchanged or reporting change is economically based
Reporting changed but change was not economically based.

mon1_empl.description: First month's employment for the quarter

3=Corporate headquarters

ces_ind.description:
Indicator showing whether the establishment participates in the Current Employment Statistics (CES) system


Blank=Account has not been identified as a CES participant
C=Account reports data under the CES system

categories.label: Account has not been identified as a CES participant
Account reports data under the CES system

ui_acct.description: U-I account number portion of SESA ID. Note: as a new UI Account number format was used starting 2016 Quarter 3, the UI Account numbers for this year and quarter will not match with UI Account numbers (empr_no) in the wage table (kcmo_lehd.mo_wage). In order to properly match these entities, you will want to use the kcmo_lehd.ui_acct_xwalk table. The values for ui_acct in mo_qcew_employers 2016q3 will match to the ui_acct_xwalk variable legacy_ean_7_nocheck and the wage ui account variable will match to the ui_acct_xwalk variable ui_ean.

pla_date.description: Most recent change date for the physical location address (yyyymmdd format)

fields.description:
Neighborhood Tabulation Areas (NTAs) were created to project populations at a small area level, from 2000 to 2030 for PlaNYC, the long-term sustainability plan for New York City. Since population size affects the error associated with population projections, these geographic units needed to have a minimum population, which were determined to be 15,000. This criterion resulted in combinations of neighborhoods that probably would not occur if one were solely designating boundaries of historical neighborhoods. Moreover, the neighborhood names associated with the neighborhood tabulation areas are not intended to be definitive.


Another feature of the sustainability plan, was the creation of projections for Public Use Microdata Areas (PUMAs), which are approximations of New York City's Community Districts developed for use with the Census Bureau's Public Use Microdata Samples (PUMS). In order to make the boundaries consistent with PUMAs, NTAs were created using whole census tracts, from the 2010 census, within PUMAs. Since NTAs were not permitted to cross PUMA boundaries, this further restricted our ability to identify what may be thought of as historical neighborhood boundaries.


Thus, users need to be cognizant of the reason why NTAs were created and the demographic/geographic constraints inherent in how they were configured. Despite these limitations, NTAs are a valuable summary level for use with both the 2010 Census and the American Community Survey (ACS). Regarding the decennial census, these geographic areas offer a good compromise between the very detailed data for census tracts (2,168) and the broad strokes provided by community districts (59). For the ACS, NTAs offer a statistically reliable alternative to the high sampling error that renders data for most individual census tracts unusable.


Note: "park-cemetery-etc" NTAs, while not contiguous, only represent five unique NTAs; one in each borough. However, each of these five NTAs may appear more than once in this table, as they may fall in more than one PUMA.
fields.source_archive: NYC Department of City Planning Open Data
fields.dataset_citation: Department of City Planning (DCP), 2010, "New York City 2010 Census Tract to 2010 Neighborhood Tabulation Area Equivalency", https://www1.nyc.gov/assets/planning/download/office/data-maps/nyc-population/census2010/nyc2010census_tabulation_equiv.xlsx, NYC Department of City Planning Open Data [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.description: LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics (LODES) used by OnTheMap are available for download below. Version 7 of LODES was enumerated by 2010 census blocks. Previous versions of LODES were enumerated with 2000 census blocks. Data files are state-based and organized into three types: Origin-Destination (OD), Residence Area Characteristics (RAC), and Workplace Area Characteristics (WAC), all at census block geographic detail. Data is available for most states for the years 2002-2014.

fields.description:
A WARN layoff is a plant closure or mass layoff. Under state law, employers must notify the state when they plan to lay off workers. This law is known as the WARN Act (Illinois Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act). This dataset was generated by ADRF participants who downloaded PDF WARN reports from the state website at https://www.illinois.gov/dceo/WorkforceDevelopment/warn/Pages/default.aspx, extracted their information to a spreadsheet and used SAS to realign the data into columns. 


Records are for the time period from 2006 to 2010 and include the month and year of the layoff report, the name, address, county and The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for the employer, as well as the type of event being reported (e.g., Layoff or Closing). FIPS codes and Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) numbers were also added to the records.
fields.source_archive: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
fields.dataset_citation: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity, 2017, "Illinois Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification (WARN) Notices of Layoffs and Closures 2008-2010", https://www.illinois.gov/dceo/WorkforceDevelopment/warn/Pages/default.aspx, Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.description:
The 2010 ZIP Code Tabulation Area (ZCTA) to Census Tract Relationship file provides a simple crosswalk between the 2010 ZCTAs and 2010 Census tracts. From this file, data users may determine which ZCTAs exist within the other geographies and vice versa. 

The ZCTA relationship files are nation-based comma-delimited ASCII files and include all 50 states, the District of Columbia, and Puerto Rico.

These files represent intersections of geography only.  For instance, for the ZCTA to place relationship file, a unique combination of ZCTA and place FIPS code must exist for a record to be included in the file. Areas where the Census Bureau has delineated a ZCTA, but no place exists, are considered remainder records and are not included in this file. Situations where no ZCTA exists or where there is neither a ZCTA nor a place are also excluded from this file. The same logic applies to all other relationship files. However, data users should be aware that the totals given for the ZCTA or the geographic entity are full totals as published for the 2010 Census, therefore, data users should note that summing the part record totals may not match the totals for the ZCTAs and/or the related entities.
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2010, "2010 Census ZIP Code Tabulation Area (ZCTA) to Census Tract Relationship File", http://www2.census.gov/geo/docs/maps-data/data/rel/zcta_tract_rel_10.txt, United States Census Bureau [Distributor], 1 [Version]
