fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
This dataset includes the main 2014, Wave 1 data file for The Survey of Income and Program Participation (SIPP) as well as the Replicate Weight File. The U.S. Census Bureau is releasing the initial version of public data from the reengineered SIPP.  This dataset contains variables from Wave 1 of the 2014 SIPP panel.  The SIPP is the Census Bureau’s premier survey for measuring the dynamics of income, employment, health insurance, and participation in government transfer programs.  The survey provides detailed, monthly information about the family, social, and economic contexts of individuals and households.  SIPP is a longitudinal survey, following the same set of respondents over a four-year period, allowing researchers to understand how these contexts change over time.


Please see the 2014 Panel Users’ Guide, included with this dataset, for more details.
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2017, "2014 Survey of Income and Program Participation Wave 1", http://thedataweb.rm.census.gov/ftp/sipp_ftp.html#sipp14, SIPP FTP Page [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_actions_required: Dataset may only be accessed and used by members of the Applied Data Analytics course using these data.
fields.title: Indiana Public Higher Education Enrollments, 2005-2006 Through 2017-2018
fields.data_usage_policy: These data are being provided for educational purposes for use in Applied Data Analytics program. Dataset may only be accessed and used by ADRF users who are members of a course using these data.
fields.data_steward_organization: Coleridge Initiative

entry_type_code.description: Entry type reported for the student (continuing student, dual credit, first-time entry, transfer, etc). Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = EntryTypeCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the EntryTypeCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

location_code.description: The Indiana county, U.S. state, or country of origin for the student at the time of first admission to an institution. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = LocationCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the LocationCode in this table to the Code field to get the label. Location codes '001' through '092' represent Indiana county codes.  Codes '101' through '151' represent state codes.  Codes '201' through '965' represent country codes and code '940', '942', '999' represents 'unknown'

residency_status_code.description: Identifies the specific residency or non-residency type of the student. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = ResidencyStatusCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the ResidencyStatusCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

degree_level_code.description: Code corresponding to the degree level of the student (ex. Certificates, Associates, Bachelors, Masters, Doctoral, etc). Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = DegreeLevelCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the DegreeLevelCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

entry_type_category_code.description: Identifies a student as degree seeking or non degree seeking. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = EntryTypeCategoryCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the EntryTypeCategoryCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

reporting_year.description: The year for which the enrollment records are being reported on.  The trailing year is reported in the records (e.g., 2014-2015 is reported as 2015)

gender_code.description: Student's gender. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = GenderCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the GenderCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

ssn_available_flag.description:
Flag to determine if the social security number is available for the student. From the 2011-2012 school forward, only the last 4-digits of the SSN were available from the higher education records.  A match was done with workforce data and other DWD (Indiana Department of Workforce Development) sources to obtain a full SSN for these students.   If a valid SSN was found for the student, a 'Y' will populate this field.  Otherwise, the field will be populated with 'N' and won't be matchable to other records.  Invalid SSNs include numbers considered invalid by the social security administration (defined at https://secure.ssa.gov/poms.nsf/lnx/0110201035).


Y=a valid SSN was available for the student
N=a valid SSN was not available for the student

categories.label: a valid SSN was available for the student
a valid SSN was not available for the student

cip_2010_six_digit_code.description: Six digit CIP 2010 federal ID  for the academic program in which the student is pursuing a degree. Lookup file in cipcodes.csv.  Match from field CIP2010SixDigitCode in this table to field cipcode in the CSV file

che_campus_unit_id.description: Unique identifier for public higher education campus where student was enrolled. Lookup file in campus_codes.csv - match from field CHECampusUnitID in this table to field CHECampusUnitID in this CSV file

ethnicity_code.description: Student's ethnicity. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = EthnicityCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the EthnicityCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

fields.access_requirements: Dataset may only be accessed and used by members of the Applied Data Analytics course using these data.
fields.description: Enrollment records from all public higher institutions in Indiana. This set includes records level data, including year of enrollment, social security number, degree by CIP and degree level of enrollment program, demographics, residency status at time of college entry, location of origin, degree seeking indicator, and entry type of student. Private institutions in Indiana are not included in this dataset.
fields.dataset_citation: Indiana Commission for Higher Education (DWD), 2019, "Indiana Public Higher Education Enrollments, 2005-2006 Through 2017-2018", Applied Data Analytics Course [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.title: City of Chicago Crimes - 2001 to Present
fields.data_usage_policy: This dataset is intended for public access and use.
fields.data_steward_organization: Center for Urban Science and Progress (CUSP), NYU

y_coordinate.description: The y coordinate of the location where the incident occurred in State Plane Illinois East NAD 1983 projection. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

case_number.description: The Chicago Police Department RD Number (Records Division Number), which is unique to the incident.

domestic.description: Indicates whether the incident was domestic-related as defined by the Illinois Domestic Violence Act.

description.description: The secondary description of the IUCR code, a subcategory of the primary description.

district.description: Indicates the police district where the incident occurred. See the districts at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/fthy-xz3r.

arrest.description: Indicates whether an arrest was made.

location.description: The location where the incident occurred in a format that allows for creation of maps and other geographic operations on this data portal. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

community_area.description: Indicates the community area where the incident occurred. Chicago has 77 community areas. See the community areas at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/cauq-8yn6.

latitude.description: The latitude of the location where the incident occurred. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

primary_type.description: The primary description of the IUCR code.

beat.description: Indicates the beat where the incident occurred. A beat is the smallest police geographic area – each beat has a dedicated police beat car. Three to five beats make up a police sector, and three sectors make up a police district. The Chicago Police Department has 22 police districts. See the beats at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/aerh-rz74.

date.description: Date when the incident occurred. this is sometimes a best estimate.

ward.description: The ward (City Council district) where the incident occurred. See the wards at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/sp34-6z76.

iucr.description: The Illinois Unifrom Crime Reporting code. This is directly linked to the Primary Type and Description. See the list of IUCR codes at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/c7ck-438e. A lookup for these codes is also available in the documentation folder of this dataset.

longitude.description: The longitude of the location where the incident occurred. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

location_description.description: Description of the location where the incident occurred.

x_coordinate.description: The x coordinate of the location where the incident occurred in State Plane Illinois East NAD 1983 projection. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

updated_on.description: Date and time the record was last updated.

fbi_code.description: Indicates the crime classification as outlined in the FBI's National Incident-Based Reporting System (NIBRS). See the Chicago Police Department listing of these classifications at http://gis.chicagopolice.org/clearmap_crime_sums/crime_types.html.

block.description: The partially redacted address where the incident occurred, placing it on the same block as the actual address.

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: This dataset reflects reported incidents of crime (with the exception of murders where data exists for each victim) that occurred in the City of Chicago from 2001 to present, minus the most recent seven days. Data is extracted from the Chicago Police Department's CLEAR (Citizen Law Enforcement Analysis and Reporting) system. In order to protect the privacy of crime victims, addresses are shown at the block level only and specific locations are not identified. Should you have questions about this dataset, you may contact the Research & Development Division of the Chicago Police Department at PSITAdministration@ChicagoPolice.org. Disclaimer: These crimes may be based upon preliminary information supplied to the Police Department by the reporting parties that have not been verified. The preliminary crime classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation and there is always the possibility of mechanical or human error. Therefore, the Chicago Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Chicago Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information. All data visualizations on maps should be considered approximate and attempts to derive specific addresses are strictly prohibited. The Chicago Police Department is not responsible for the content of any off-site pages that are referenced by or that reference this web page other than an official City of Chicago or Chicago Police Department web page. The user specifically acknowledges that the Chicago Police Department is not responsible for any defamatory, offensive, misleading, or illegal conduct of other users, links, or third parties and that the risk of injury from the foregoing rests entirely with the user. The unauthorized use of the words "Chicago Police Department," "Chicago Police," or any colorable imitation of these words or the unauthorized use of the Chicago Police Department logo is unlawful. This web page does not, in any way, authorize such use. Data are updated daily. The dataset contains more than 65,000 records/rows of data and cannot be viewed in full in Microsoft Excel. Therefore, when downloading the file, select CSV from the Export menu. Open the file in an ASCII text editor, such as Wordpad, to view and search. To access a list of Chicago Police Department - Illinois Uniform Crime Reporting (IUCR) codes, go to http://data.cityofchicago.org/Public-Safety/Chicago-Police-Department-Illinois-Uniform-Crime-R/c7ck-438e.  A lookup for these codes is also available in the documentation folder of this dataset.
fields.source_archive: City of Chicago Open Data Portal
fields.dataset_citation: Chicago Policy Department, 2018, "City of Chicago Crimes - 2001 to Present", https://data.cityofchicago.org/Public-Safety/Crimes-2001-to-present/ijzp-q8t2, City of Chicago Open Data Portal [Distributor], 1 [Version]

shared_work_hours.description: Number of hours worked during a week covered by the Shared Work Program

claim_week_ending_date.description: Saturday date of the week being certified

paid_amount.description: Amount claimant was eligible to receive for the week certified

shared_work_plan_id.description:
Shared Work is the MO Short Time Compensation (STC) layoff aversion program.
Employers can elect to reduce a group of worker's hours instead of laying off workers.  The workers are eligible for a percentage of unemployment benefits equal to the percentage of their reduction in hours

claim_type.description:
Type of unemployment claim (Regular UI or Extended Benefits)


REG=Regular Unemployment
SEB=State Extended Benefits
TUC=Federal Extended Benefits

work_during_week.description: Did the claimant perform work during the claim week

claim_id.description: Unique identifier for each unemployment claim filed.

fields.description: Record level data from Missouri Department of Labor and Industrial Relations on monthly individual unemployment insurance payments. Dataset includes hashed SSN to link to claims data, claim ID, program type, date and amount of payment.

fields.description: The American Community Survey (ACS) is part of the U.S. Census Bureau's Decennial Census Program and is designed to provide current demographic, social, economic, and housing estimates throughout the decade. Table DP05 provides demographic characteristics: the number of people by age, sex, race and of voting age.
fields.dataset_citation: US Census Bureau, 2010, "American Community Survey 2015 5yr estimates - ACS DEMOGRAPHIC AND HOUSING ESTIMATES", https://factfinder.census.gov/faces/nav/jsf/pages/download_center.xhtml#none, US Census Bureau American FactFinder [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.description: The dataset contains locations and attributes of Homeless Shelters, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. A database provided by the Department of Human Services identified Homeless Shelter locations.

fields.description: Missouri state LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics (LODES) used by OnTheMap are available for download below. Version 7 of LODES was enumerated by 2010 census blocks. Previous versions of LODES were enumerated with 2000 census blocks. Data files are state-based and organized into three types: Origin-Destination (OD), Residence Area Characteristics (RAC), and Workplace Area Characteristics (WAC), all at census block geographic detail. Data is available for most states for the years 2002-2015.
